summary: This is a medical laboratory report from the Federal Bureau of Prisons for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, detailing the results of blood chemistry, hematology, and serology tests collected on July 9, 2019, while he was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The report shows several abnormal values, including elevated cholesterol, triglycerides, and hemoglobin A1C.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical laboratory report, identified by his inmate registration number, date of birth, and facility location. The report details his blood test results.

events.title: Epstein's Blood Sample Collection
events.description: Blood samples were collected from Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for laboratory analysis.

events.title: Epstein's Lab Results Reported
events.description: Laboratory test results for Jeffrey Epstein, including chemistry, hematology, and serology panels, were finalized and reported.

locations: U.S. Medical Center for Federal Prisons, 1900 W. Sunshine Street
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York under registration number 76318-054 as of July 2019.
Blood tests were performed on Epstein on July 9, 2019, with results reported on July 10, 2019.

The lab report indicates several abnormal or high results, including elevated cholesterol (216 mg/dL), high triglycerides (413 mg/dL), and a Hemoglobin A1C level of 6.3%, which is in the 'Increased Risk' category for diabetes.
Other notable results include a non-reactive RPR test (for syphilis) and a negative HIV 1/2 screening test.
The document is a standard Bureau of Prisons medical lab report, providing a snapshot of Epstein's health shortly before his death in August 2019.
